meanings.definition: A stall or stand where books are sold.
meanings.sent1: At the bookstall, you can find many interesting stories to read.
meanings.sent2: I bought a new novel from the bookstall at the market.
meanings.sent3: The bookstall at the fair was so popular that even the birds wanted to browse!
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a bookstall overflowing with tales waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The bookstall under the old oak tree beckoned to all who passed by.

meanings.definition: To sell books from a stall or stand.
meanings.sent1: She decided to bookstall her collection of rare books at the local flea market.
meanings.sent2: The author bookstalls his latest work every weekend at the street corner.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked that she could bookstall books faster than anyone else in town.
meanings.sent4: His words bookstalled through the crowd, enticing listeners to purchase his stories.
meanings.sent5: The bookshop owner had to bookstall outside during the festival to attract more customers.
